personalInfo.education: San Diego State University (2008, Business Finance)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Additional Qualifying Tournament Finisher or Finished 76-100 on 2014 Web.com Tour Money List
tourBios.intlVics: (3): 2010 Clublink Jane Rogers Championship [Can], Players Cup [Can], Canadian Tour Championship [Can].
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Finished T114 at Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament in December...Entered 14 Web.com Tour events, posting two top-10s and three top-25s. Made seven cuts. Finished the season 85th on the money list...As a Monday qualifier for the Northern Trust Open on the PGA TOUR in February, shot 71-73 to miss the cut on the number...Posted a first-round 70 at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open in late March. Coupled consecutive rounds of 67 with a bogey-free, final-round 68 to earn a T5 finish, his best Tour performance since a T4 at the 2012 WNB Golf Classic...In April, made first Tour ace on 12th hole of the El Bosque Mexico Championship during the first round...Next top-25 came in early July at the Nova Scotia Open, where he opened with a 65 and was in second place. Followed with rounds of 72-68-73 to finish T7...Missed another top-10 the next week after opening with rounds of 67-67-64 (was in second, four back), only to close with a 73 while playing with eventual champion Andres Gonzales. Finished T11.

2013: Made the cut in seven of 19 Web.com Tour starts...Was T9 at the Panama Claro Championship to begin the year...Finished T22 in the first domestic event, Chitimacha Louisiana Open...Missed eight of nine cuts in April, May and June...Third and final top-25 came at Utah Championship...Closed out the Regular Season by missing his final three cuts to finish 99th on the money list. 

2012: Made the cut in 17 of 27 starts and had eight top-25 finishes. Wound up No. 46 on the money list. Was one of four players to play in all 27 events...Had his first top-10 of the season, a T9 at the Panama Claro Championship in March...Came back three months later and added a second top-10, a T6 at the Mexico Open. Had four par-or-better rounds at El Bosque CC...Was T4 at the WNB Golf Classic in late September, finishing at 15-under par and two shots back of winner Luke Guthrie...Ended the year No. 4 in Driving Accuracy and No. 5 in Greens in Regulation but struggled with his putting, finishing No. 110 in Putts per Round. 

2011: Missed the cut in three of his first five starts but closed the year by making 11 consecutive cuts...The rookie picked up his first top-10 performance in his fourth start of the year, at the Chiquita Classic. Played in the final group Sunday, but an even-par 72 left him T8...Notched his second top-10, at the News Sentinel Open. Carded a 7-under 65 in the third round to earn a spot in the final group. A 1-under 71 left him four-strokes back and T5...Shot a 7-under 65 in the final round of the Children's Hospital Classic to finish solo third. Played the final 33 holes without a bogey. Earned enough money to move up 15 places, to No. 43 on the money list...Ended the year No. 7 in Driving Accuracy Percentage (72.52 percent) and No. 9 in Scoring Average (69.55). 

2010: Shot a 63 at Turtle Bay to take top honors at the Monday qualifier to earn a spot in the field at the Sony Open in Hawaii, finishing T72. It was his lone made cut in three PGA TOUR starts...Won the Canadian Tour Players Cup in July, a day before his 25th birthday to earn a spot in the RBC Canadian Open...In only Web.com Tour start, finished T36 at the Ford Wayne Gretzky Classic...Named Player of the Year on the Canadian Tour after winning the order or merit. Won three times in a four-tournament span late in the season. Also had three other top-10s early in the year. Earned $156,118 to break Trevor Dodds' 1996 single-season money record on Tour. 

2009: Member of the Canadian Tour. 2008: Made the cut at the Miccosukee Championship and finished T45.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Two-time All-American and the Mountain West Conference Player of the Year. Was a member of the U.S. Palmer Cup team in 2008.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was 3rd in 2011 at the Children's Hospital Classic.
